attributes.action: Make all health care assistants in hospitals a band 3
attributes.additional_details:
As the national minimum wage rises to £9.50. The pay for a band 2 hca stays at around £10.18 an hour. 
I call for all band 2 hca’s to be moved to a band 3
attributes.background:
HCA’s in the Nhs are band 2,  HCA’s are the most patient facing staff in the Nhs.
We are doing clinical observations that are not in our job description but without the willingness of HCA’s to do this the Nhs would struggle even more.

rejection.details: The NHS is responsible for decisions around pay bands for healthcare assistants, rather than the Government. You could start a petition asking the Government to review the pay of healthcare assistants more widely.
